Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly black-figured, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed brown with traces of added red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lotus flower and stem.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Lemos, the sherd belongs to the group of black-figured chalices with floral decoration. There is, however, no evidence of black figure decoration on this sherd.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 332, no. 1615, pl. 208)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 81, no. 8, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1332) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
